subject: Ethics
title: Paternalism vs Patient Choice
description: Learn Paternalism vs Patient Choice in one minute.

hook.text: A doctor hides a terminal diagnosis from a patient because 'the truth would destroy her.' Ethical?

buildup.text: Medical paternalism means doctors decide what's best, sometimes overriding or withholding from patients.

discovery.text: For most of history, this was standard. Doctors controlled information and decisions 'for the patient's good.'

twist.text: Studies show patients given full information make better decisions and report less anxiety, not more.

climax.text: Modern ethics shifted power to patients. But in some cultures, families still expect doctors to decide.

punchline.text: Protecting people from truth isn't protection. It's control.

quiz.question: What do studies show about patients who receive full information about their diagnosis?
options: They make better decisions and report less anxiety
They panic and make worse decisions
